text: John Langshaw "J. L." Austin (26 March 1911 â€“ 8 February 1960) was a British philosopher of language. He was born in Lancaster, Lancashire. He supported ordinary language philosophy. He developed the theory of speech acts.Warnock, G. J. "John Langshaw Austin, a biographical sketch". Symposium on J. L. Austin, ed. K.T. Fann. New York: Humanities Press, 1969. p. 3. He worked at Oxford University. He was awarded Order of the British Empire for his services during World War II. Austin died of lung cancer in Oxford on 8 February 1960 at the age of 48. ==References== Category:1911 births Category:1960 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in England Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:British philosophers Category:British military personnel of World War II Category:Writers from Lancashire Category:People from Lancaster, Lancashire
title: J. L. Austin
